data.title: Dr. Angelica Clark, MAc, ND, DC
data.text:
Angelica Clark, MAc, ND, DC graduated from Robert Morris University with her bachelor’s degree in Applied Health Sciences. She later obtained her Master’s degree in Acupuncture along with her Doctorate in Naturopathic and Chiropractic medicine from National University of Health Sciences.

Dr. Clark addresses all primary care needs, with a special interest in gastrointestinal health, autoimmune diseases, thyroid, cardiovascular health, diabetes, and stress-related disorders. Dr. Clark’s goal is to help her patients find the underlying cause of their concerns and provide their body the “tools” it needs to heal itself. She does this by establishing the foundations for optimal health which is sleep, hydration, nutrient dense foods, stress management, and active movement.

Dr. Clark is a board-certified Chiropractic physician in the state of Illinois. Graduated with honors in Acupuncture, Naturopathic and Chiropractic medicine at National University of Health Sciences.

What are you most passionate about professionally? Personally

Professionally I am passionate about providing my patients with the pathway to meet their health-related goals. Personally, I love learning new things and enjoying life.

What three traits define you?

Compassionate, detail oriented, and honest.

Who is your ideal client and why should they connect with you?

My ideal client is someone who is seeking a natural or alternative solution for their health concern(s). That client would be committed to accepting and following my recommended treatment to improve their health.

What’s the biggest proof that you’re good at what you do?

When my patients start feeling better, and we resolve their health concerns, and they are able to accomplish more in their daily lives. It’s wonderful when I can see the progress they make, and all of their hard work has paid off.

What are you complimented on most in your work?

For being helpful and competent, I always keep my client’s best interests top of mind.

What’s your biggest accomplishment?

I have earned 3 degrees simultaneously over the past 6 years. I’m proud of how much I have learned and grown professionally and personally. I couldn’t have done it without the support of my husband, family and friends.

What would you do even if you didn’t get paid to do it?

I would organize everything possible. Organization simplifies my life by making everything easier to find, with less stress, when you need them.

What are you surprisingly good at?

I am surprisingly good at swimming. I started swimming at the age of 3 and swam competitively throughout my youth.

What’s one thing you couldn’t live without?

I cannot live without tea. I love the smell, taste and comfort. Whether it’s caffeinated tea such as green or black tea or herbal tea like peppermint, chamomile or apple spice. Iced tea during the summer and hot tea during the winter, just love it all!

What do you do for fun in your spare time? What are your hobbies?

I spend my spare time with my husband, family or friends. My hobbies include disc golfing with my husband (that’s how we met). I enjoy swimming for exercise and relaxation. I love dining out, going to the movies, listening to music, and going to concerts. Lastly, I enjoy painting portraits, landscapes and abstracts.
